intro: Phyllanthus betsileanus subsp. betsileanus, commonly known as the Betsilean phyllanthus, is a shrub native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to the island's unique ecological conditions. Its botanical features include smooth, often waxy leaves and a compact growth form. It is of interest to botanists due to its restricted distribution and potential medicinal properties.
